result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BRIAN D ERICKSON

defendant.name: ERICKSON, BRIAN D
defendant.address: 1230 E HAMILTON AVE, EAU CLAIRE, WI 54701

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
BOND IN 21CF440 (MODIFIED) TO ALSO APPLY TO 22CF369 (NEW)
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / any syringes unless medically required.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs / anv prescription drugs not prescribed.
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.
No contact with Victim 1. their residence, or their place of employment and not to be within 3 blocks Victim 1's residence or place of employment.

9:00 AM Defendant BRIAN D ERICKSON in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for BRIAN D ERICKSON.  Attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
21CF440: Motion Hearing- Attorney Field does not have any objections to Motion in Limine filed by ADA Yohnk.
Motion in Limine is granted. 
Matter currently set for trial.
Parties to appear at 8:30 a.m. day of trial to address any final issues.

22CF369: Initial Appearance: Attorney waives reading of complaint. 
Defendant is informed of charges and penalties. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.
To ride along WITH 21CF440.
Initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

The original document was titled: Criminal Complaint Victim Key
The original history event date is: 06-10-2022
